bibl.title: Letter from Currier McEwen to Philip Showalter Hench, September 14, 1951

div1.p: McEwen thanks Hench for the detailed information regarding Reed's diplomas and the dates of his time in college. He informs Hench that Reed's children are unable to attend the University's events celebrating the centennial of their father's birth.

div1.head: Letter from Currier McEwen to Philip Showalter Hench, September 14, 1951
div1.opener:
NEW YORK UNIVERSITY-BELLEVUE MEDICAL CENTER
NEW YORK UNIVERSITY COLLEGE OF MEDICINE
477 FIRST AVENUE, NEW YORK 16, N.Y.
September 14, 1951
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
OREGON 9-3200
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
I have received a copy of your letter to John
Whelden and meanwhile he has already spoken with me about
what you wrote. We already knew about Major General Walter
Lawrence Reed and Mrs. Blossom Reed and had invited them.
To our regret we heard from them only today and learned
that they will be unable to come.

Thanks ever so much for the detailed information
regarding Walter Reed's diplomas and the dates of his
college experience. The date of his graduating class given
in Whelden's letter to you was, of course, a mistake and I
am very glad you brought it to Whelden's attention because
he might have used it in some of his news releases which would
have been unfortunate.

On my return to the office the other day from a
holiday in Maine I also found the announcement of the marriage
of your daughter. My hearty congratulations to you and Mary
and best wishes to the two young people.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, Currier McEwen, M.D.
Dean Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
